page.title: 13GEOLOGY & NATURAL RESOURCES
page.content: The ice sheets retreated, exposing the Keuper deposits of the{Triassic Age. The{Beaker People}migrated in, gladly cultivating the Lower Sandstone beds in the West (and the intrusion in the North East) and grazing on the Marl elsewhere. Their cultural descendants - the Fast Food Folk - are still there: for this is Nature's Own Wonderful Hamburger Land, where all the ingredients abound for the picking.Onions, salad and french fries in the West: buns on the intrusion; beef (cheese too) in the centre.And there are{salt}deposits on the side as well. It probably says much about the level of enterprise of the natives when one realises that they have signally failed to reap advantage from this wondrous Natural Resource that lies beneath their unresponsive feet.
